metadata.Title: CVE-2019-1125 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An information disclosure vulnerability exists when certain central processing units (CPU) speculatively access memory, aka 'Windows Kernel Information Disclosure Vulnerability'. This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2019-1071, CVE-2019-1073. Andrei Vlad Lutas and Dan Lutas discovered that some x86 processors incorrectly handle SWAPGS instructions during speculative execution. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information (kernel memory).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-1125` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-159-generic - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-lowlatency - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-4.4.0-159-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-159-generic - 4.4.0-159.187
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-159-lowlatency - 4.4.0-159.187
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1090-aws - 4.4.0-1090.101
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Andrei Vlad Lutas and Dan Lutas

notes.Note: tyhicks> This issue is not believed to be exploitable in the Linux kernel but kernel updates will be made available to ensure that it cannot be exploited Kernel updates will soon be available for testing in the Proposed pocket and they are expected to be officially released on August 12th See the following page if you'd like to test the patched kernels from the Proposed pocket: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Testing/EnableProposed

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-159.187').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1090.101').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1045.47~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1055.60').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1040.42~16.04.1').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1054.61').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1021.23~16.04.1').
linux-signed package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-159.187').
linux-signed-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1045.47~16.04.1').
linux-signed-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1055.60').
linux-signed-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1040.42~16.04.1').
linux-signed-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-58.64~16.04.1').
linux-signed-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-signed-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1021.23~16.04.1').
